sentences.sContent: formal recognition of the reformed church
sentences.sCn: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认

sentences.sContent: a formal agreement between the countries
There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.sCn: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

sentences.sContent: ...People would come in out of a formal and almost Victorian attitude...
...a relatively formal distance should be kept between professors and their students...
...Another reason why teachers should maintain a formal students with their students is to avoid real and perceived bias...
...maintaining a formal distance between teachers and students can ensure an atmosphere of authority in the classroom and avoid both real and perceived bias...
...One reason to maintain a formal distance between students and teachers is to highlight the instructor’s role as an authority figure...
...Real-life experience is often more important than formal education for career success...
...Some said he had no formal education...
...they do follow some formal customs when visiting homes...

synos.tran: 正式的；拘谨的；有条理的
正式的社交活动；夜礼服

phrases.pCn: 正规训练；形式练习；正式训练
正式聚会，正式的欢迎会
正式合同；流通票据（可转让的票据）；要式合同

words.tran: 没有形状的；无定形的；形体不明的
形式，形状；形态，外形；方式；表格
礼节；拘谨；仪式；正式手续
使正式；使有效（formalize的过去分词）；使定形；拘泥于形式
构成，组成；排列，组织；产生，塑造
使形式化；使正式；拘泥礼仪

trans.tranOther: made or done officially or publicly
